rounds.category: ALFRED NOBEL, THIS IS YOUR LIFE

clues.text: Alfred's will lays out his prizes, specifying that one is for holding these congresses & reducing standing armies
In 1863 Nobel patented this innovative "cap", a detonator for triggering explosives
A turning point was when this type of newspaper article was published in error & Alfred was shocked by how he'd be remembered
Early in his career, a factory Alfred had built to produce this liquid explosive blew up, killing his brother Emil
An ailing Alfred died in this Italian city then known for "San"atoria & now for a music festival
The covenant creating this league in 1919 mentions the goal "to promote international cooperation"
The NCL, or "National" these people's "League", works for economic justice for shoppers
Hiawatha is traditionally credited as one of the founders of this league of 5, then 6 nations
In the 19th century the Land League on this island sought to gain more rights from their British landlords
"Defenders of soil, air, woods, waters & wildlife" is the compleat motto of the league named for this 17th c. Brit
The film "What's New Pussycat?", about a guy women chase, had a title song by this guy women chased
Phoebe on "Friends" was known to warble about this feline
The feline in this Harry Chapin song was accompanied by "Little Boy Blue and the Man in the Moon"
This quartet sang "Our house is a very very very fine house, with two cats in the yard, life used to be so hard"
Members of The Cure wore kitty costumes in the video for this poppy tune, the band's first U.K. Top 10 hit
This Man in Black of country music wrote "The Man in White" about St. Paul & Jesus
"The Dolorous Passion of Our Lord Jesus Christ" by Anne Emmerich inspired a 2004 movie from this director
"The Gospel According to" this "Myra Breckinridge" author moves the crucifixion to the television age
The Greek Orthodox church tried & failed to excommunicate Nikos Kazantzakis for writing this 1955 novel
This title item of Jesus' clothing is won by a Roman soldier in a dice game in a Lloyd Douglas novel
A performer who overacts
This is played when 2 autos are headed straight for each other, with the loser being the first to turn away
Escaped prisoners are said to be "on" this slang word
Federal appropriations for friends
A citizen of a town, whether it's Calais or not
In this Steinbeck work, Lennie remembers what to do if anything goes wrong: "Hide in the brush an' wait for George"
Claudia & her brother run away from home & hide in this NYC museum in "From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler"
Peter Pettigrew transformed into a rat & hid that way for 12 years as the pet of Percy & then this younger brother
The unnamed title character of this novel by Ralph Ellison lives in "a hole in the ground" in a basement
Can't do the category without this 1847 novel where the insane Mrs. Rochester is kept locked up in the attic
Charlize Theron
Penelope Cruz
Heidi Klum
Seal
Jean-Claude Van Damme
In Judaism, this rite of passage is celebrated around the time of a boy's 13th birthday
The Catholic rite for this sacrament begins with asking the parents what they name their child
In this religion, a book of the dead called the "Bardo Thodol" is read to the dying to help them prepare for a favorable rebirth
Casting 7 stones at each of the 3 pillars of Mina is a rite enacted during the pilgrimage with this name
This rite is a solo vigil by a Plains Indian boy to seek spiritual power & knowledge through an apparition

rounds.category: THE RHYME OF SIR NEVILLE MARRINER

clues.text:
Sir Neville Marriner, famous conductor/
played this classical fiddle & was an instructor

Neville went for Baroque with this man's "Four Seasons"/
The critics all loved it & they had their reasons

Sir Nev had 3 Grammy awards in his tally/
With one for this film about Wolfie & Sali

Critics agree the results were quite Bela/
When Nev did the works of this composing fella

Fans of Sir Neville habitually hearten/
to hear him with this band that mentions St. Martin
clues.response: the Academy of St. Martin in the Fields

clues.text: The name of this large sea comes from words for "middle of the land"
This 19,340-foot African peak is said to be the highest "walkable" mountain in the world
It's Paraguay's largest city
The Dole Pineapple Company once owned 98% of this 5-letter Hawaiian island
The dodo once made its home on this island about 500 miles east of Madagascar
An intoxicated person is this many "sheets to the wind"
Channels in a classical Doric column, or the January date of a traditional presidential inauguration
"Formula" this "cleans up after grease, grime & gusto"
In a 1920s phrase it precedes "skidoo"
Martin Luther's posted number of theses
In April 2017 United Airlines upped its limit to $10,000 in compensation to passengers bumped due to this
Originally a sheep with a noisemaker around its neck, now it's an indicator of a future trend
Saving syllables? Use this synonym in place of "belligerent"
Coal-burning stove with a large, rounded chamber
Professional also known as a bean counter

rounds.text: British biochemist J.B.S. Haldane's essay on ectogenesis, birth outside the womb, helped inspire this 1932 novel
